intro: Juno warleyensis, commonly known as the Warley junco, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, often pink or red flowers. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Juno warleyensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
